text: Vermont and North Dakota had the lowest unemployment rates in July.
July average weekly earnings ranged from Mississippi's $721 to Washington’s $1,167.
Only Wyoming’s GDP decreased between Q1 2018 and Q1 2019.
Louisiana was the only state with a year-over-year decline in total employment in July.
Private employment in July was up 3% or more over the year in five states.
Over the year, July state and local public employment increased the most in NV, NM, and ID.
Utah was one of 21 states with a decade-low unemployment rate in July.
Alabama was one of 5 states with a decade-high annual growth in house prices in Q1 2019.
